title: Why is inting and intentionally losing not bannable and only words are.
body:
Complete and utter lack of priorities. You can mute someone saying shit but you can't stop the person running down mid over and over. Guess who can get banned?

It's actually impossible to get banned for inting or intentionally losing. Seen people do it 20 in a row and no problem, but say 1 bad word in 1 game and you can be banned for 2 weeks. 

I mean damn did all the %%%%s at riot get bullied as kids or something.

Not banned just curious how fucked up in the head you can be for that to be your priority.

Don't forget that it's only if *you* are the toxic one.

Everyone else who is toxic won't get banned, even if you report them.

> [{quoted}](name=Best Evelynn OCE,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AHVFgEfu,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-10T08:18:37.811+0000)
>
> Don't forget that it's only if *you* are the toxic one.
> 
> Everyone else who is toxic won't get banned, even if you report them.

I heard a quote the other day about workplaces:

"every work place has 1 or 2 jerks. But if _everyone_ at your work is a jerk, maybe YOU are the jerk."

I don't believe that you can get banned for saying one bad thing in ONLY one game. If that were the case there would be more banned accounts than playing ones.

In other words, you would have to be insulting others or saying bad things a lot, over many games. Those people running mid (maybe) only did it one game, therefore they don't get punished, or maybe not as severely. 

Be the change you want to see. Fight the toxicity, not your team mates. Fight the urge to fight on their playing field. Report them, continue on.  The only people you should be fighting in a League of Legends game, is your enemy. 

Eventually, with this method, you will have helped to remove many others that do not care for other's experience. Either by ban, or by reform. 


Keep doing your best, you'll get there.

I think they are far more reliant on bots these days.

Problem with bots, ia that they need a learning period, in which the first phase of testing is always going to be a nightmare. Observe the YouTube ad-friendly content bot. 

Bots are the easy way to fix a widespread problem, but if done incorrectly, will cause more problems than solving them by a term I'll call "blanketing".  To effectively use bots, they need a small, focussed team helping with the bot to... Teach it what is right and wrong. What to remove and what not to.

  I myself haven't had problems with the system, but if so many people are getting hit by the ban hammer... Well let's just say some of them need it, but a lot of others don't. 

We just need to wait and see how this plays out. That's the only thing we can do at this point. Hide from the automatic system. Hope you don't get covered by the "blanket" and Mr Sandman Bot putting your account to "sleep".
